Subjective: Hard stools, difficulty passing, 2-3 days without bowel movement, ongoing 3 months. Abdominal pain, cramps, painful on pressure, bloated, stomach swollen. No change in eating habits; eats little, always. No further weight loss; already underweight, stable. No blood in stool. No changes in urination. Periods regular. No other family members with bowel problems (sister has ulcerative colitis, but different symptoms). Impact on daily life: Discomfort from hard stools and abdominal pain. Request: Concerned if serious; wants to know what to do to soften stool; wants to know if olive oil is permanent solution; wants help with underweight/dietician.
Objective: Abdomen: Normal bowel sounds. Palpation: Painful on pressure. Sensitive in lower left abdomen. Percussion: Varying tympani, dampening in lower left abdomen. Renal lodges: No pain. Upper abdomen: No pain. Lower right abdomen: No pain.
Assessment: Irritable Bowel Syndrome (IBS) with constipation predominance, susp. No alarm bells for serious pathology. Ulcerative colitis ruled out (different symptoms).
Plan: Explanation: Symptoms consistent with IBS (constipation type); stool becomes hard.
Meds: Psyllium fiber sachets, daily with plenty of water for 6 weeks.
Lifestyle: Continue with plenty of water.
Safety Netting: Return sooner if abdominal pain worsens, fever develops, or sudden significant blood in stool.
Follow-up: Re-evaluate in 6 weeks. Discuss dietician referral next time.
